key_title: Key to the species of Dichondra

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Convolvulaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Bindweeds (Convolvulus L.: Convolvulaceae) in Victoria
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (2012). Bindweeds (Convolvulus L.: Convolvulaceae) in Victoria. In: Victorian Naturalist 129, pp. 10-19. Field Naturalist Club of Victoria, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Fruiting pedicels 5–60 mm long, straight to sinuate; sepals 2–3 mm long at flowering, extending to >3 mm long in fruit; fruits not longer than calyx
Fruiting pedicels mostly 3–15 mm long, strongly recurved; sepals 1–2 mm long at flowering, extending to 3 mm long in fruit; fruits longer than calyx

Upper surface of leaf moderately hairy with more or less erect hairs; lower surface moderately to densely silky with appressed hairs; hairs with arms 0.3–1 mm long; capsules 2.5–3 mm long; seeds 2–3 mm long
Upper surface of leaf glabrous or nearly so; lower surface sparsely pubescent; hairs with arms 0.2–0.3 mm long; capsules 2–2.5 mm long; seeds 1.5–2 mm long
